Sentencas: Glass and glass-ceramics (GCs) of the CaO-SrO-B2O3-TiO2-SiO2 system are promising candidates as sealants for solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs), mainly because of the possibility of the formation of Sr2SiO4 and Sr(TiO3) as crystalline phases, which minimizes the interfacial reaction between the interconnection elements and the sealant.
Titulo: Sintering and crystallization of SrO-CaO-B2O3-SiO2 glass-ceramics with different TiO2 contents

Sentencas: Four glass compositions of this system, with different TiO2 content, were obtained.
Titulo: Sintering and crystallization of SrO-CaO-B2O3-SiO2 glass-ceramics with different TiO2 contents

Sentencas: The crystalline phases formed after crystallization were identified by X-ray diffraction (XRD).
Titulo: Sintering and crystallization of SrO-CaO-B2O3-SiO2 glass-ceramics with different TiO2 contents

Sentencas: Combining Differential Scanning Calorimetry (DSC) and Optical Microscopy (OM), it was found that the overall activation energy for crystallization did not change with TiO2 content.
Titulo: Sintering and crystallization of SrO-CaO-B2O3-SiO2 glass-ceramics with different TiO2 contents

Sentencas: The predominant crystallization mechanism is controlled by the surface, and the growth of the crystalline layer is governed by diffusion.
Titulo: Sintering and crystallization of SrO-CaO-B2O3-SiO2 glass-ceramics with different TiO2 contents

Sentencas: The sintering behavior was investigated by DSC and Hot Stage Microscopy (HSM).
Titulo: Sintering and crystallization of SrO-CaO-B2O3-SiO2 glass-ceramics with different TiO2 contents

Sentencas: All glass compositions exhibited a single-stage shrinkage behavior, but those with a larger amount of TiO2 showed high sinterability.
Titulo: Sintering and crystallization of SrO-CaO-B2O3-SiO2 glass-ceramics with different TiO2 contents

Sentencas: The measured coefficient of thermal expansion (CTE) varied from 10.2 x 10(-6) K-1 (100-550 degrees C) in the glass to 13.9 x 10(-6)
Titulo: Sintering and crystallization of SrO-CaO-B2O3-SiO2 glass-ceramics with different TiO2 contents

Sentencas: K-1 (100-550 degrees C) in the GCs, which is in good agreement with the typical CTE of SOFC components.
Titulo: Sintering and crystallization of SrO-CaO-B2O3-SiO2 glass-ceramics with different TiO2 contents

Sentencas: These consistent values of the CTE and good sintering behavior allow us to propose that the glass composition with a higher percentage of titanium is a promising candidate for further experimentation and development as a sealant material.
Titulo: Sintering and crystallization of SrO-CaO-B2O3-SiO2 glass-ceramics with different TiO2 contents
